clinical_study.brief_title: Nitrate Supplementation in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Dietary Nitrate Supplementation on Metabolic Efficiency in Patients With COPD

brief_summary.textblock: Each subject will consume (in a randomized fashion) both the intervention beverage (nitrate solution) and the placebo, separated by a 1 wk washout period. The investigators will test the hypothesis that 7 days of dietary nitrate supplementation will improve metabolic efficiency in patients with COPD compared to the placebo.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in metabolic efficiency during exercise
primary_outcome.description: Metabolic efficiency (degree of efficiently used energy during exercise) will be assessed during the test days before and after the two supplementation periods (active and placebo) for a total timespan of 3 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in blood pressure during exercise
secondary_outcome.description: Change in blood pressure will be assessed during the test days before and after the two supplementation periods (active and placebo) for a total timespan of 3 weeks.
Change in dyspnea will be assessed during the test days before and after the two supplementation periods (active and placebo) for a total timespan of 3 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in cycle endurance time during exercise.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in cycle endurance time will be assessed during the test days before and after the two supplementation periods (active and placebo) for a total timespan of 3 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in oxygen uptake (VO2 mL/min) during exercise
secondary_outcome.description: Change in oxygen uptake will be assessed during the test days before and after the two supplementation periods (active and placebo) for a total timespan of 3 weeks.
Change in REE will be assessed during the test days before and after the two supplementation periods (active and placebo) for a total timespan of 3 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in plasma concentrations of nitrate and nitrite, glucose, insulin, lactate and free fatty acids, IFABP and cardiac troponin
secondary_outcome.description: Change in these plasma concentrations will be assessed during the test days before and after the two supplementation periods (active and placebo) for a total timespan of 3 weeks.

other_outcome.measure: height, body weight and body mass index (BMI)
Fat free mass and fat mass
other_outcome.description: Fat free mass and fat mass determined by DEXA-scan

intervention.description: 7 days of supplementation with sodium nitrate solution
7 days of supplementation with sodium chloride solution

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- COPD
- Indication metabolic inefficiency
Exclusion Criteria:
- Sodium intake limitation
- Long-term oxygen therapy
- Severe renal impairment
- Use of medications that may interact with nitrate
- Contra-indications for performing (sub)maximal cycle ergometry
